Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
game.GameBoard
public class GameBoard extends Object
Class that stores information about the GameBoard

    • gameOver

      public boolean gameOver()
      Returns whether the game is over
      Returns:
      true if the game is over, false otherwise

    • isLineValid

      public boolean isLineValid(int startRow, int startCol, int endRow, int endCol)
      Checks if a line is valid
      Parameters:
      startRow - the start row of the line
      startCol - the start column of the line
      endRow - the end row of the line
      endCol - the end column of the line
      Returns:
      true if the line is valid, otherwise false

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove(Player player, int startRow, int startCol, int endRow, int endCol)
      Creates a line from the two dots
      Parameters:
      player - the player making the move
      startRow - the start row of the line
      startCol - the start column of the line
      endRow - the end row of the line
      endCol - the end column of the line

      public int getMoves()
      Gets the current number of moves
      Returns:
      the number of moves so far

      public void printBoard()
      Prints the current state of the board

    • getPlayersBoxes

      public int getPlayersBoxes(Player player)
      Gets the number of boxes claimed by player RED
      Returns:
      the number of boxes RED has claimed

    • getGoal

      public int getGoal()
      Gets the end goal for the game
      Returns:
      the number of claimed boxes that signifies the end of the game

    • setGameOver

      public void setGameOver(boolean isGameOver)
      Sets whether the game should end
      Parameters:
      isGameOver - true if the game should end
